instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7050: What is D7050? Diodes between SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL and ground, these data lines allow the battery to communicate with the battery charging chip and the SMC..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stops charging randomly.
threads.message: This board had an SMC replacement and works fine most of the time but will occasionally stop charging. The MagSafe light will go out at that point. <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> are measuring normally. Diode measurement on pin 2 of each is right around .513. Continuity to <DIODE>D7050</DIODE> is good. Tested with known good battery. Not sure what else could be causing this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stops charging randomly.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stops charging randomly.
threads.message: Charger light going out would indicate a One wire problem. Known good magsafe board? When the light goes out does the system still think there is a charger connected or switch to battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stops charging randomly.
threads.message: Known-good MagSafe. It switches to battery and start to drain it when the MagSafe goes out. It thinks the power adapter has been disconnected. <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> area is completely clean and measures correctly. <RESISTOR>R5187</RESISTOR> is clean and measures normally. <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> is clean and was not touched. Pin 14 is normal. Continuity is good throughout <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> lines. That line is measuring .466 to ground in diode mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stops charging randomly.
threads.message: Does ACOK go down when light goes out? Will it shut down when you disconnect the battery when light goes out?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stops charging randomly.
threads.message: I'm now waiting for it to fail. It's hooked up. It may take a a while.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stops charging randomly.
threads.message: Ok, this board has been hooked up, with all components, outside of the case (so I can measure the bottom) and it still hasn't failed. In the case it will fail within about 30 minutes, usually. The only thing I'm not using from the original setup is the keyboard. Any chance a keyboard could affect this? Seems highly unlikely, but I'm stuck since I can't get this thing to fail.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stops charging randomly.
threads.message: It is possible that it thinks you're holding power button when you're not or that it thinks you are trying to reset the SMC. Try it again with a different keyboard. I would hope it is that rather than some random crack in the board that flexes just enough once screwed in for it to stop working.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stops charging randomly.
threads.message: Thanks, it's been running fine now for over a day inside the case with original components. I knew this would be a nightmare. It just doesn't fail consistency enough to get any feedback. It has all screws in now so it looks like its might not be a damaged board or loose component being affected by board flexing. Being that the SMC was replaced, I feel like something is slightly off with that, or with a component surrounding it. Can't see what it might be, but I'm out of ideas.
